column2: What are some ingredients you find yourself using often? These can be spices, cuts of meat, vegetables etc.
What recipes do you find yourself making often?
What ingredients do you find yourself wasting most often?
What do you think is important in food management?
Knowing how much of something is left and when to buy more
avoiding cross contamination with dietary needs / allergies
reducing waste, I often buy loads of fresh foods and don't cook that often so it goes to waste.
Accurate date of when food shouldn’t be eaten/goes off (not best before)
Knowing when your ingredients get spoiled and how to store them properly
Batch cooking meals to last you a few days, saves time and allows for healthy fresh meals
Only buying what you will actually use
Cross contamination control, expiry date management
